Dear Ms. Borja:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on October 20,
2021. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
MISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that
violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3012

II. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
DHHS Policy Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary
FOM 722-08E
Within three business days of foster care/juvenile
Justice program//case closure, using the DHS 69 Foster
Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary, the caseworker
must document:
 Reason for program/case closure.
 Reason the current program type continues to be
appropriate if the child had multiple open
programs and one program has closed while the
other remains open.
 How and when information related to the care
and supervision of the child or program/case
closure was shared with relevant parties.
 Information given to parent (s), guardian, or
youth age18 or older at program/care closure.
The caseworker must document all case service delivery
from the report period end date of the previous case
service plan through the program or case closure date,
including:
……………………
The caseworker must document whether:
 Medical information was given to the parents or
next placement and the date provided.
4

 Education information was given to the parents or
next placement and the date provided.
 Closure was explained to all parties.
One out of two closed foster children’s case records reviewed, the DHS
Form was not completed within three days of the case closure. The
foster care case closed on 5/28/21 and the DHS 69 was completed on
7/29/21.
THIS WAS A REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL DATED
SEPTEMBER 2, 2020.
III. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
IV. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
V. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a CAP on September 17, 2020, for the Renewal Inspection
completed on September 2, 2020. The agency had one repeat violation during
this Interim Inspection. The agency was in violation with their last Renewal
Inspection with the following:
 Three CPA Rules
 Ten DHS Policies
VI. ANALYST REPORT
There were no identified safety concerns.
5

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Macomb County DHHS
continue on a regular license.
